results.title: Light
results.creator_credit: ABC-TV (Australia), Victorian College of Agriculture and Horticulture and Ivo Burum
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Growing awareness: Factors in plant production”.
Photosynthesis is the process by which a plant converts the energy from sunlight into sugars in specialised cells called chloroplasts. Respiration is the releasing of energy stored in sugars in the parts of the cells called mitochondria. The manipulation of light to simulate the natural habitat, shows how plant science can measure the relationship between light level and growth to determine optimum growing conditions.

results.title: Lifting patients. Part 2. In the home
results.creator_credit: Kinocraft and Great Britain. Ministry of Health
results.brief_description: Demonstrates lifting techniques and explains the principle on which they are based, which removes the possibility of spinal injuries and strain. Primarily for district nurses, health visitors and others in the field of domiciliary nursing and could also be extremely useful to relatives who are nursing patients at home.

results.title: Lifting and Carrying
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Safetycare”.
The correct techniques and an understanding of the principles of safe lifting is essential knowledge. This video examines the correct procedures for different types of objects and underlines the principles of safe lifting techniques.

results.title: Lifting and carrying
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Safetycare”.
Despite rapid and continued advances in mechanisation methods, it will always remain impossible to eliminate physical involvement within the working environment. Material handling occurs in one way or another in every department of every business on every working day, so it is not surprising that accidents resulting from incorrect handling techniques comprise nearly 30% of occupational injuries, with the most common injury being back pain. This video and trainer’s manual highlights the construction of the spine and its limitations and clearly illustrates how and why injuries will occur if we do not respect the limitations and use correct lifting and carrying techniques.

results.title: Lifting
results.creator_credit: CWS Film Unit for Ministry of Labour and George Wynn
results.brief_description: Thousands of men and women injure themselves in lifting or moving heavy weights. This films shows the right way to tackle a number of jobs so as to avoid accidents and strains and to make the jobs themselves easier.

results.title: Lift to the scaffold = L'Ascenseur pour l'echafaud
results.creator_credit: Nouvelles Éditions de Films, Jean Thuillier and Louis Malle
results.brief_description: This taut, tense and incredibly fast paced thriller features Jeanne Moreau and Maurice Ronet as passionate lovers who embark on a plan to murder her husband. However, the plan goes terribly wrong when the murderer finds himself trapped in a faulty lift. While his lover searches frantically through Paris for him, he grows increasingly more desperate, and she finds herself trapped in another’s scheming plans. Based on a novel by Noel Calef, Louis Malle directs with an audacious vitality, while Moreau and Ronet are wonderful as the callous lovers. The film’s musical score is by jazz legend Miles Davis. The film won the prestigious Prix Delluc, one of French cinema’s most important awards. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: Lift-off at the Wackadoo Cafe
results.creator_credit: Australian Children's Television Foundation, Patricia Edgar and Paul Nichola
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Lift off”.
How do you get to the Wackadoo Cafe? All you need to do is shout “Wackadoo” and you’re there! These are 10 episodes of Wackadoo Cafe from the children’s TV series Lift off, as seen on ABC TV. Wackadoo is a crazy cafe run under the strict orders of ‘The Boss’. ‘Zelda’ the waitress weaves confidently amongst the customers, while ‘Nearly’ is nervously in charge of the drinks. ‘Cook’ a true artiste, creates works of genius in the kitchen. Regular customers are ‘Wolf’, a faded star, and the three pigs ‘Boris’, ‘Doris’ and ‘Moris’, who invariably display their mean streak. ‘Lonely’ is there too, always waiting for a friend.

results.title: Lifetimes of change: development and growth
results.creator_credit: Educational Media International and Australian Academy of Science
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Web of life”.
Shows the changes that take place within the lifetimes of individual organisms. Illustrates the ideas of birth, growth, change and decay by using three examples from the natural world: toadstools, frogs and flowering plants. Also notes the main changes in structure and in behaviour that distinguish a human lifetime. Suitable for upper secondary level.
